It will mean that China no longer is involved in convincing, along with us, for Kim Jong Il to get rid of his weapons. It’s a big mistake to do that.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We must have China’s leverage on Kim Jong Il, besides ourselves.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And if you enter bilateral talks, they’ll be happy to walk away from the table. I don’t think that’ll work.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: All right. Mr. President, this is the last question. And two minutes. It’s a new subject — new question, and it has to do with President Putin and Russia. Did you misjudge him or are you — do you feel that what he is doing in the name of antiterrorism by changing some democratic processes is OK?

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: No, I don’t think it’s OK, and said so publicly. I think that there needs to be checks and balances in a democracy, and made that very clear that by consolidating power in the central government, he’s sending a signal to the Western world and United States that perhaps he doesn’t believe in checks and balances, and I told him that.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I mean, he’s also a strong ally in the war on terror. He is — listen, they went through a horrible situation in Beslan, where these terrorists gunned down young school kids. That’s the nature of the enemy, by the way. That’s why we need to be firm and resolved in bringing them to justice.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: That’s precisely what Vladimir Putin understands, as well.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I’ve got a good relation with Vladimir. And it’s important that we do have a good relation, because that enables me to better comment to him, and to better to discuss with him, some of the decisions he makes. I found that, in this world, that it’s important to establish good personal relationships with people so that when you have disagreements, you’re able to disagree in a way that is effective.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And so I’ve told him my opinion.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I look forward to discussing it more with him, as time goes on. Russia is a country in transition. Vladimir is going to have to make some hard choices. And I think it’s very important for the American president, as well as other Western leaders, to remind him of the great benefits of democracy, that democracy will best help the people realize their hopes and aspirations and dreams. And I will continue working with him over the next four years.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: Ninety seconds, Senator Kerry.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Well, let me just say quickly that I’ve had an extraordinary experience of watching up close and personal that transition in Russia, because I was there right after the transformation. And I was probably one of the first senators, along with Senator Bob Smith of New Hampshire, a former senator, to go down into the KGB underneath Treblinka Square and see reams of files with names in them.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: It sort of brought home the transition to democracy that Russia was trying to make.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I regret what’s happened in these past months. And I think it goes beyond just the response to terror. Mr. Putin now controls all the television stations. His political opposition is being put in jail.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And I think it’s very important to the United States, obviously, to have a working relationship that is good. This is a very important country to us. We want a partnership.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But we always have to stand up for democracy. As George Will said the other day, “Freedom on the march; not in Russia right now.”

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, I’d like to come back for a quick moment, if I can, to that issue about China and the talks. Because that’s one of the most critical issues here: North Korea.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Just because the president says it can’t be done, that you’d lose China, doesn’t mean it can’t be done. I mean, this is the president who said “There were weapons of mass destruction,” said “Mission accomplished,” said we could fight the war on the cheap — none of which were true.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We could have bilateral talks with Kim Jong Il. And we can get those weapons at the same time as we get China. Because China has an interest in the outcome, too.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: Thirty seconds, Mr. President.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You know my opinion on North Korea. I can’t say it any more plainly.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: Well, but when he used the word “truth” again…

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Pardon me?

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: … talking about the truth of the matter. He used the word “truth” again. Did that raise any hackles with you?

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Oh, I’m a pretty calm guy. I don’t take it personally.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: OK. All right.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You know, we looked at the same intelligence and came to the same conclusion: that Saddam Hussein was a grave threat.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And I don’t hold it against him that he said grave threat. I’m not going to go around the country saying he didn’t tell the truth, when he looked at the same intelligence I did.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: It was a threat. That’s not the issue. The issue is what you do about it.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The president said he was going to build a true coalition, exhaust the remedies of the U.N. and go to war as a last resort.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Those words really have to mean something. And, unfortunately, he didn’t go to war as a last resort.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now we have this incredible mess in Iraq — $200 billion. It’s not what the American people thought they were getting when they voted.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: All right, that brings us to closing statements.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: And, again, as determined by a coin toss, Senator Kerry, you go first, and you have two minutes.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Thank you, Jim, very much.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Thank you very much to the university, again.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Thank you, Mr. President.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: My fellow Americans, as I’ve said at the very beginning of this debate, both President Bush and I love this country very much. There’s no doubt, I think, about that.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But we have a different set of convictions about how we make our country stronger here at home and respected again in the world.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I know that for many of you sitting at home, parents of kids in Iraq, you want to know who’s the person who could be a commander in chief who could get your kids home and get the job done and win the peace.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And for all the rest of the parents in America who are wondering about their kids going to the school or anywhere else in the world, what kind of world they’re going to grow up in, let me look you in the eye and say to you: I defended this country as a young man in war, and I will defend it as president of the United States.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But I have a difference with this president. I believe when we’re strongest when we reach out and lead the world and build strong alliances.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I have a plan for Iraq. I believe we can be successful. I’m not talking about leaving. I’m talking about winning. And we need a fresh start, a new credibility, a president who can bring allies to our side.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I also have a plan to win the war on terror, funding homeland security, strengthening our military, cutting our finances, reaching out to the world, again building strong alliances.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I believe America’s best days are ahead of us because I believe that the future belongs to freedom, not to fear.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: That’s the country that I’m going to fight for. And I ask you to give me the opportunity to make you proud. I ask you to give me the opportunity to lead this great nation, so that we can be stronger here at home, respected again in the world, and have responsible leadership that we deserve.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Thank you. And God bless America.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: Mr. President, two minutes.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Thank you very much tonight, Jim. Senator.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: If America shows uncertainty or weakness in this decade, the world will drift toward tragedy. That’s not going to happen, so long as I’m your president.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: The next four years we will continue to strengthen our homeland defenses. We will strengthen our intelligence-gathering services. We will reform our military. The military will be an all-volunteer army.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We will continue to stay on the offense. We will fight the terrorists around the world so we do not have to face them here at home.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We’ll continue to build our alliances. I’ll never turn over America’s national security needs to leaders of other countries, as we continue to build those alliances. And we’ll continue to spread freedom. I believe in the transformational power of liberty. I believe that the free Iraq is in this nation’s interests. I believe a free Afghanistan is in this nation’s interest.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And I believe both a free Afghanistan and a free Iraq will serve as a powerful example for millions who plead in silence for liberty in the broader Middle East.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We’ve done a lot of hard work together over the last three and a half years. We’ve been challenged, and we’ve risen to those challenges. We’ve climbed the mighty mountain. I see the valley below, and it’s a valley of peace.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: By being steadfast and resolute and strong, by keeping our word, by supporting our troops, we can achieve the peace we all want.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I appreciate your listening tonight. I ask for your vote. And may God continue to bless our great land.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: And that ends tonight’s debate. A reminder, the second presidential debate will be a week from tomorrow, October 8th, from Washington University in St. Louis. Charles Gibson of ABC News will moderate a town hall-type event. Then, on October 13th, from Arizona State University in Tempe, Bob Schieffer of CBS News will moderate an exchange on domestic policy that will be similar in format to tonight’s.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: Also, this coming Tuesday, at Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland, the vice presidential candidates, Vice President Cheney and Senator Edwards, will debate with my PBS colleague, Gwen Ifill, moderating.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: For now, thank you, Senator Kerry, President Bush.

Title: September 30. 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSH, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA), DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: LEHRER
Text: From Coral Gables, Florida, I’m Jim Lehrer. Thank you and good night.
